gameplay

Class BoardArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.BoardArea

  • public class BoardArea
extends java.lang.Object

    This class implements areas on the board, including neighbours, building costs, number of minions on the spot, if there is a building, etc with their related rules and all information relevant to that area on the board.
    Thus, it is just the area enumeration plus the state.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Team 10 - SOEN6441

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoardArea()
      This constructor is invoked to create objects from the class Area.
      BoardArea(AnkhMorporkArea area_)
      This constructor is invoked to create objects from the class Area.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addBuildingForPlayer(Player p)
      Adds a building to this board area for the given player.
      Note that a building cannot be added to an area that contains a trouble marker or already contains a building.
      boolean addDemon()
      Increments the number of demons on the area.
      Demons are regarded as minions so they will affect trouble in the area.
      void addMinion(Player p)
      This method adds the minion of the player in the city area, and justifies the balance of stocked minions.
      boolean addTroll()
      Increments the number of trolls on the area.
      Trolls are regarded as minions so they will affect trouble in the area.
      boolean addTroubleMarker()
      This method adds trouble markers to the city area in case there has not been any before.
      void clearAllPieces()
      Removes all the pieces from this area (minions, trouble marker, building).
      From what I understand these are not handed back to the players.
      AnkhMorporkArea getArea() 
      int getBuildingCost()
      Retrieves the cost of placing a building in the area.
      Color getBuildingOwner()
      Get the color of the building, which indicates the player to whom the building belongs.
      int getDemonCount()
      Get the number of demons.
      int getMinionCount() 
      int getMinionCountForPlayer(Player p)
      This method determines the number of minions of the player.
      java.util.Map<Color,java.lang.Integer> getMinions()
      Get the minions of each player mapped with a color.
      int getTrollCount()
      Get the number of trolls.
      boolean hasTroubleMarker()
      Checks to see if there is a trouble marker in the city area.
      boolean isControlledBy(Player p)
      Determines whether this board area is controlled by the given player.
      An area is controlled by a player if (s)he "has more playing pieces in it than any single other player (a playing piece being a minion or a building) and has more pieces than the total number of trolls in the area".
      An area that has at least one demon cannot be controlled.
      boolean isNeighboringWith(BoardArea card2)
      This method checks to see the neighbour of the city area.
      boolean removeBuilding() 
      boolean removeDemon()
      Decrements the number of demons on the area.
      Demons are regarded as minions so they will affect trouble in the area.
      boolean removeMinion(Player p)
      This method removes the minion of the player from the city area, and justifies the balance of stocked minions.
      boolean removeTroll()
      Decrements the number of trolls on the area.
      Trolls are regarded as minions so they will affect trouble in the area.
      boolean removeTroubleMarker()
      This method removes a trouble marker.
      Returns true if there was previously a trouble marker on area.

      • addBuildingForPlayer

        public boolean addBuildingForPlayer(Player p)
        Adds a building to this board area for the given player.
        Note that a building cannot be added to an area that contains a trouble marker or already contains a building.
        Parameters:
        p - the player
        Returns:
        true if the building was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • removeMinion

        public boolean removeMinion(Player p)
        This method removes the minion of the player from the city area, and justifies the balance of stocked minions. Also, if the area has a troublemarker it is removed.
        Parameters:
        p - the player

      • addTroll

        public boolean addTroll()
        Increments the number of trolls on the area.
        Trolls are regarded as minions so they will affect trouble in the area.
        Returns:
        true if adding a troll succeeded, false otherwise.

        public boolean addTroubleMarker()

        Returns:
        true if it a trouble marker was added successfully.

      • removeTroubleMarker

        public boolean removeTroubleMarker()

      • clearAllPieces

        public void clearAllPieces()
        Removes all the pieces from this area (minions, trouble marker, building).
        From what I understand these are not handed back to the players.

      • isControlledBy

        public boolean isControlledBy(Player p)
        Determines whether this board area is controlled by the given player.
        An area is controlled by a player if (s)he "has more playing pieces in it than any single other player (a playing piece being a minion or a building) and has more pieces than the total number of trolls in the area".
        An area that has at least one demon cannot be controlled.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        the total number of areas controlled by the given player.
